results.byline: By Alan Feuer and Charlie Savage
results.title: Appeals Court Scraps Special Master Review in Trump Documents Case
results.abstract: The panel’s decision removed a major obstacle to the Justice Department’s investigation into Mr. Trump’s handling of sensitive government documents.

media.caption: The Justice Department is investigating former President Donald J. Trump’s handling of about 13,000 documents and photographs that were hauled away from Mar-a-Lago by the F.B.I. in August.
media.copyright: Maddie McGarvey for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Fashion and Apparel;Child Abuse and Neglect;Child Pornography;Advertising and Marketing;audio-neutral-informative;audio-negative-sad;Gvasalia, Demna;Galimberti, Gabriele;Balenciaga (Fashion Label)
results.byline: By Elizabeth Paton, Vanessa Friedman and Jessica Testa
results.title: When High Fashion and QAnon Collide
results.abstract: Two new Balenciaga campaigns ignited a firestorm that traveled from the internet to Fox News, fueled by allegations that the brand condoned child exploitation.

media.caption: The fallout began on Nov. 16, when Balenciaga published a campaign called Balenciaga Gift Shop, which featured images of children with the brand’s handbags that look like teddy bears in bondage gear.

results.title: Yes, ‘Cocaine Bear’ Was Real. Here’s the Back Story.
results.abstract: Nearly 40 years after a 175-pound black bear found and ingested cocaine in a Georgia forest, the drug binge has inspired a movie.

media.caption: The movie “Cocaine Bear” offers a fictionalized account of what happened when a black bear found several pounds of cocaine in Georgia in 1985.
media.copyright: Matt Stone/Courier Journal, via Imagn Content Services

results.title: Judge Declares Mistrial in Danny Masterson Rape Case
results.abstract: A jury in Los Angeles said it was deadlocked on the three charges against the actor known for his role in “That ’70s Show.”

media.caption: Danny Masterson leaving Los Angeles Superior Court with his wife, Bijou Phillips, on Wednesday after a judge declared a mistrial in his rape case.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Pop and Rock Music;McVie, Christine;Fleetwood Mac
results.title: Christine McVie, Hitmaker for Fleetwood Mac, Is Dead at 79
results.abstract: As a singer, songwriter and keyboardist, she was a prolific force behind one of the most popular rock bands of the last 50 years.

media.caption: Christine McVie of Fleetwood Mac in performance at Madison Square Garden in 2014. Her commercial potency was on full display on Fleetwood Mac’s “Greatest Hits” anthology: She either wrote or co-wrote half of its 16 tracks.

results.title: In Georgia, Walker’s Pace in the Finish Worries Republican Allies
results.abstract: The Senate candidate’s performance in the final days of the runoff campaign has Republicans airing frustrations. But no one is counting him out yet.

media.caption: Herschel Walker greeting guests during a campaign event on Monday.

results.title: Verdict in Trump Organization Trial Could Come Down to 3 Little Words
results.abstract: What jurors make of the phrase “in behalf of” could decide whether the former president’s namesake company is guilty of tax fraud.

media.caption: Donald J. Trump’s company provided fancy perks to executives, who did not pay taxes on them.

results.title: Supreme Court to Hear Student Debt Forgiveness Case
results.abstract: The justices left in place an injunction blocking the Biden administration’s authority to forgive up to $20,000 in debt per borrower.

media.caption: Activists calling on President Biden in Washington in April to cancel student debt.

results.byline: By Jin Yu Young and Victoria Kim
results.title: ‘Gangnam Style’ Brought K-Pop to the World, but Haunted Its Creator
results.abstract: In 2012, the song took over the internet, and it helped pave the way for the global success of Korean pop. But Psy, the artist behind it, spent years trying and failing to replicate the phenomenon.

media.caption: Psy during an interview on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of his hit “Gangnam Style,” at his office in Seoul (specifically, in the Gangnam area).
media.copyright: Chang W. Lee/The New York Times

results.title: Buckingham Palace Staff Member Resigns Over Remarks to Black Guest
results.abstract: The founder of an antiviolence support group said an aide pressed her on where she was from, dismissing Britain as an answer. The palace called the questioning “unacceptable and deeply regrettable.”

results.title: Best TV Shows of 2022

results.title: Physicists Create ‘the Smallest, Crummiest Wormhole You Can Imagine’
results.abstract: Scientists used a quantum computer to explore the ultimate escape route from a black hole.

media.caption: One clue that the researchers were actually recording “wormholelike” behavior was that signals emerged from the other end of the wormhole in the order that they went in.

results.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Blames ‘Huge Management Failures’ for FTX Collapse
results.abstract: Mr. Bankman-Fried spoke at The New York Times’s DealBook conference, in his first public appearance since his crypto exchange imploded.

results.adx_keywords: Pop and Rock Music;McVie, Christine;Fleetwood Mac
results.title: Christine McVie’s 12 Essential Songs
results.abstract: The singer, songwriter and keyboardist, who died on Wednesday, was a hitmaker for Fleetwood Mac whose crystalline voice and roots in the blues gave her music a distinct emotional punch.

media.caption: Christine McVie in 1969. The following year, she joined Fleetwood Mac.

results.adx_keywords: Mental Health and Disorders;Hospitals;Homeless Persons;Psychiatry and Psychiatrists;audio-neutral-informative;Adams, Eric L;New York City
results.byline: By Andy Newman and Emma G. Fitzsimmons
results.title: New York City to Involuntarily Remove Mentally Ill People From Streets
results.abstract: Mayor Eric Adams directed the police and emergency medical workers to hospitalize people they deemed too mentally ill to care for themselves, even if they posed no threat to others.

media.caption: In a speech on Tuesday, Mayor Eric Adams issued a directive telling city agencies to transport people with severe mental illness to hospitals.
media.copyright: Benjamin Norman for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Rescues;Travel and Vacations;Ships and Shipping;Cruises;Maritime Accidents and Safety;Carnival Corporation;Cruise Lines International Assn;United States Coast Guard;Gulf of Mexico
results.title: A Man Fell From a Cruise Ship. And Survived.
results.abstract: He treaded water for hours in the Gulf of Mexico, withstanding rain, winds and waves before he was rescued. Others have not been so lucky. What happens when a person goes overboard?

media.caption: James Grimes, 28, fell from the Carnival Valor sometime after it left the Port of New Orleans on Nov. 23. He was found alive in the Gulf of Mexico on Thanksgiving Day.

results.adx_keywords: Brain;Implants;Paralysis;Computers and the Internet;Medical Devices;Regulation and Deregulation of Industry;Musk, Elon;Food and Drug Administration;Neuralink Corp
results.byline: By Christina Jewett and Cade Metz
results.title: Elon Musk Hopes to Test a Brain Implant in Humans Next Year
results.abstract: The tech multibillionaire said his company, Neuralink, was seeking government approval to test his device in people, and predicted it could happen in six months. Others have been conducting similar tests for years, but no device has been marketed commercially.

media.caption: In this still image from the Neuralink presentation video on YouTube, a presenter, lower left, described how a monkey used a wireless transmitter to “type” characters on a keyboard.

results.byline: By Eric Adelson and Michael S. Schmidt
results.title: Former Gaetz Confidant Is Sentenced to 11 Years in Prison
results.abstract: Joel Greenberg, a tax collector in Florida, had been cooperating with the Justice Department in its investigation into Representative Matt Gaetz.

media.caption: A judge excoriated Joel Greenberg’s behavior in sentencing him to 11 years in prison.
media.copyright: Joe Burbank/Orlando Sentinel, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Television;internal-sub-only
results.title: Stephen Colbert Is Conflicted Over Oath Keepers Leader’s Conviction
results.abstract: Colbert said he felt “pretty darn good” about Stewart Rhodes’s verdict: “and I feel a little bad about that, because the thing I feel great about is somebody else going to prison.”

media.caption: Stephen Colbert noted that Rhodes’s conviction marked the first time that a jury had decided that the violence on Jan. 6, 2021, was the product of an organized conspiracy.
